definition: car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: The Ford Mustang was originally based on the Ford Falcon compact.
sentences.chinese: 福特野马是基于福特猎鹰系列小型车而生产的。

sentences.english: We want to become the best small car producer in the industry.
sentences.chinese: 我们要成为业内最好的小型车制造商。

sentences.english: Traveling thousands of miles in a comppskillicipingested car was pretty rough.
sentences.chinese: 坐着小型车旅行数千里实在是太难受了。

sentences.english: Funny that an innocuous runabout could stir such feelings of derision.
sentences.chinese: 可笑的是这种无害的小型车竟然能得到如此多的嘲笑。

sentences.english: It needs to add small cars to the lineup.
sentences.chinese: 它需要小型车来扩充它的阵容。

sentences.english: Traveling thousands of miles in a compact car was pretty rough.
sentences.chinese: 坐着小型车旅行数千里实在是太难受了。

sentences.english: The rise of small cars has helped to reduce emissions of carbon dioxide.
sentences.chinese: 小型车数量的增加将助于二氧化碳排放量的减少。

sentences.english: You can get the feel of a compact car in no time.
sentences.chinese: 你很快就能把小型车摸清楚。

sentences.english: He drives a small Volkswagen now and wants to upgrade.
sentences.chinese: 张仪开的是一款大众的小型车，但现在想换辆好的。

sentences.english: We have a compact available for $ 19.95.
sentences.chinese: 我们有一部现有的小型车，十九元九毛五一天。

sentences.english: California small-car buyers tend to buy imports.
sentences.chinese: 加州小型车买主倾向于买进口货。

sentences.english: Small-engine cars also require less room on the highway.
sentences.chinese: 小型车在高速公路上占的空间很小。

definition: Toyota or Toyoda (name)/Toyota, Japanese car make
Mazda, Japanese car make (derived from name Matsuda 松田)/also known as 萬事得|万事得
enclosed carriage for carrying passengers/motor carriage/car or bus/limousine/CL:部[bu4],輛|辆[liang4]
Škoda, Czech Republic car manufacturer, a subsidiary of Volkswagen Group
